utilities

Class Socket

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.Socket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MoveNotifier, java.util.Observer

    public class Socket
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoveNotifier, java.util.Observer
    Abstract socket class that allows for communication with connected host. This class is used by both client and server. On server side disconnect and reconnect shouldn't be called since it will fail to create new connection. Known BUG: ObjectInputStream creation might fail once in thousand times thus making Socket throw exception. Did not find good solution to this problem so It is advisable to just connect again. For security reasons Socket tries to connect only twice but Server or client could try few more times.

      • Socket

        public Socket(MoveNotifier master,
              java.lang.String ip,
              int port,
              int interval)
       throws SocketException
        Client constructor
        Parameters:
        master - master of this component
        ip - IP of a host to connect to. Can be ipv4 or ipv6. Could be known host name.
        port - Port of a host to connect to.
        interval - Interval between each successful socket reads and writes.
        Throws:
        SocketException - on any error related to socket.

        socket - Socket to set up IO from.
        interval - Interval between each successful socket reads and writes.
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any argument is null

      • updateMessage

                          Message msg)
        Description copied from interface: MoveNotifier

        Specified by:
        updateMessage in interface MoveNotifier
        Parameters:
        src - Source of move
        msg - msg sent by source.

      • requestMessage

        public Message requestMessage(MessageType type)
                       throws SocketException
        Makes information for Socket that specified message is requested and will be returned through this method instead of NotifyMasterObserverAboutXXX() Waits in 10ms intervals for 5 seconds
        Parameters:
        type - Type of a message to receive. Cannot be null
        Returns:
        Message received. Null if not one was received within specified time
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error or when IO was not initialised.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the timeout is lesser than or equal to 0 while the wait is true
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If type is null

      • requestMessage

        public Message requestMessage(int timeout,
                              int interval,
                              MessageType type)
                       throws SocketException
        Makes information for Socket that specified message is requested and will be returned through this method instead of NotifyMasterObserverAboutXXX()
        Parameters:
        timeout - how long to wait in microseconds in total. 0 will work like wait = false
        interval - how long to wait in microseconds between checking if something was delivered.
        type - Type of a message to receive. Cannot be null
        Returns:
        Message received. Null if not one was received within specified time
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error or when IO was not initialised.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the timeout is lesser than zero or interval is non positive
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If type is null

      • checkPing

        public long checkPing()
        Checks approximate communication latency with host.
        Returns:
        Estimated time, -1 if response was not received within 5 seconds, most likely signifing broken connection

      • Connect

        public boolean Connect(java.lang.String ip,
                       int port,
                       int interval)
                throws SocketException
        Tries to connect to specified host.
        Parameters:
        ip - IP of a host to connect to.
        port - Port of a host to connect to.
        interval - Interval between each successful socket reads and writes.
        Returns:
        Whether it was successful or not.
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error.

      • Disconnect

        public void Disconnect()
                throws SocketException
        Disconnects from currently connected host. If there is no active connection or it is already closed then this method does nothing.
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error.

      • Reconnect

        public boolean Reconnect()
                  throws SocketException
        Tries to reconnect to previously connected host.
        Returns:
        Whether it was successful or not.
        Throws:
        SocketException - on communication error.

        Returns:
        whether it was successful.
        Throws:

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks whether the socket is connected to server.
        Returns:
        true if yes.

      • isWorking

        public boolean isWorking()
        Checks whether is Socket currently trying to send or receive messages.
        Returns:
        true if yes.
